page.statement:
To complete this module you need to pass the following assessment; the passmark is 100%.

We recommend you read the questions carefully before answering. Once you have moved on you cannot return to previous questions.

question.text: Which of the following statements regarding spores is correct?
question.ans: Spores cause food to develop bad smells
Spores survive high temperatures, drying and disinfection
Spores can, under optimum conditions, divide into two every 10 minutes

question.text: What is the range of temperatures known as the "danger zone"?
question.ans: Within which food poisoning bacteria are most likely to grow
The temperatures used to ensure all bacteria are destroyed

question.text: Which of the following are all required for the multiplication of food poisoning bacteria?
Which of the following statements is true?
question.ans: Food poisoning bacteria are unlikely to grow in acidic foods
Most bacteria are capable of causing illness
Bacteria are microscopic organisms only found on people, raw food and soil
Raw foods are rarely contaminated with food poisoning bacteria

question.text: Which of the following is within the danger zone temperature?
In ideal conditions, how quickly can some food poisoning bacteria double in number?
In which of the following foods do food poisoning bacteria best multiply in?
Which of the following statements is true?
question.ans: Bacteria can multiply slowly in frozen food
It is safe to store high-risk foods within the danger zone

question.text: Which of the following will accelerate food spoilage?
Which of the following often causes food spoilage?
Which of the following statements is correct?
question.ans: Food spoilage is always prevented by temperatures below 7°C
Food will not spoil if it is thoroughly cooked
Food which is spoilt looks, tastes and smells normal
Spoilage can be prevented by good hygiene

question.text: Which of the following are all signs of spoilage?
question.ans: The presence of mould, discolouration and unusual odour
Discolouration, the presence of bacteria and low temperatures
An unusual odour, the presence of enzymes and blood
The presence of any insects, dented cans and no packaging
